She's afraid, but determined to keep it together.If her daughter is alive, she's worried about her but also knows she can take care of herself if needs be.If her child is bad, she laments when she even survived. She is despondant and grieving.
session_synopses.RaiderMurderous: a goblin participating in a large raid - speaks maliciously about killing the youngsters at the raid target
session_synopses.Refugee002: One half of a couple the player may have spoken to previously. He's mentioned working as a guard before, but when it comes to actually fighting he's a little scared. Cheerfulness masking real fear and doubt.
session_synopses.AD_KidStory: The bard is telling a story to distract the children from the impending battle. She herself is barely holding back her own fear.
session_synopses.AD_BardDefendsKids: The bard takes a last stand to defend children from goblins who've gotten past the gate. We might have discovered her backstory - where her mentor and other travelling companions were recently slaughtered in similar fashion.
session_synopses.BackupLeader: Cerys is a tiefling ranger who has been out scouting the road ahead for Zevlor/Asharak, trying to find a way through the goblins on the road. She returns just after the attack on the den to discover her leader is dead, and that she'll have to take his place. She seeks player out immediately and forces a dialogue..
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeaderSighing: Mol is muttering to herself while listening to the bard's tale in the back of the cave..
session_synopses.Sapper_004: a goblin carrying explosives into the attack on the grove
session_synopses.RitualDruid005: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Tahani blames the player and the tieflings for bringing a fight to their door, and she's not shy about telling them.
session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos, a tiefling, is praying/hiding while the goblins attack the Druid Grove. He admits that he's lost his nerve and doesn't want to fight off the attackers. We can try to persuade him and give him courage; if we succeed, he'll join the defences. Fail, and he'll continue cowering.
session_synopses.HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin meets with Kagha after returning to the grove. He chastises her for her actions during his absence. Depending on Kagha's demeanour, he may soften his tone or not.They disperse after this dialog.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: Child is sitting listening to a story - aware of the chaos going on around her but confident it will turn out alright because that's what her sister has told her.
session_synopses.AD_WarehouseLooters: Two goblin raiders are looting the Grove Storehouse.
session_synopses.AD_GrumpyAndArrogant: Two goblins talk after a victorious raid at the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefAndLooters: The warchief hassles two other goblins, demanding why raiding the nearby storehouse is taking so long.
session_synopses.Refugee003: Bex and her partner Danis have been roped into acting as medics for anyone wounded during the attack.
session_synopses.LairDoor: NOTE: the 'lair door' speaker is supposed to be Marcoryl, one of the druid servants (though he is unseen throughout, behind a locked door)Doni the grunting tiefling kid stands by the sealed entrance to the druid lair. A voice from with warns both player and Doni away. It becomes apparent that the druid servants have sealed themselves in the inner sanctum before asn impending goblin attack, Efforts by the player to get them to open the sanctum to others fail  - the servants just want to ensure their own safety.
session_synopses.Grunting: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted.
session_synopses.AD_CoweringRefugee004: Goblins have broken in and started killing civilians. Toron shouts with fear and panic.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Guard nervously awaiting the start of a battle. Player may have met previously, when her legs were immobilised by a potion.
session_synopses.AD_DrowCommander: Minthara looks at the map on the table at the den where the leader is after the plea at the gates. She is communing with her god - the Absolute - quietly, as she plans her next move.
session_synopses.RaidersArriveAfterFight: the drow commander and goblins arrive during the attack on the grove to find the player has already gone hostile to the tieflings by attacking them. The drow is amused that the player would start the slaughter without her and either joins them to finish off the tieflings, or gives futher orders if all are dead
session_synopses.RaiderArrogant: archer attacking the tieflings at the grove
session_synopses.Pet004: A boar has just survived an attack on its home and is strutting about the place proudly
session_synopses.DruidGuard003: Mino, one of the druids guarding the den, reacts to its successful defence. He also reacts if the tiefling refugees have left and if victory was secured owing to the assassination of the goblin leadership
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is trying to distract the children from battle preparations going on around them.
session_synopses.BirdSender: This dialogue takes place in two different states. The first is after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. In the second state, the goblin leaders have been killed and the tieflings in the grove are leaving. She's aware of the hard work ahead required to make things go back to normal, but she's hopeful all the same.There's an extra node to acknowledge the missing idol, if it went missing before one of those two states were triggered.
session_synopses.AD_BickeringTrainees: Gan and Ide are guard trainees "defending" one of the two hideout entrances together and bicker about which one will kill more goblins.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave: Memnos is burying his friend, Arka, if she died while defending the druid grove. He refers to another tiefling, Kanon, who died during a previous attack.
session_synopses.Refugee004: Refugee on the verge of panic with a battle set to take place outside. Quietly furious the player is not up on the walls protecting them.
session_synopses.ZenBear: After a huge fight at her home, this bear is either depressed and tired because she can't find her master, or happy and content because she's finally found her master.
session_synopses.AD_Refugees: Okta, Ikaron, Danis and Bex are standing around the shelter area waiting for the attack to begin..
session_synopses.Stargazer: The region is under attack by Goblins; she's taken shelter with the rest and is nervous and afraid.
session_synopses.Trainee002: Child who's been trained to fight - swelling with pride and confident they can handle whatever's coming.
session_synopses.Sapper_002: goblin carrying explosives into the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Adventurer2: Remira is an adventurer we've already met - she dislikes tieflings but is staying to defend because they gave her injured friend shelter when they didn't have to.
session_synopses.RitualDruid003: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Inwe is rattled to the bone by the battle. She doesn't feel safe in the grove anymore after seeing so much bloodshed.
session_synopses.AD_CheckingBarricade: Lakrissa and Kaldani are going back and forth over a barricade they're building together in preparation for the attack. They're friends joking around to hide their nerves about the incoming goblins..
session_synopses.AD_StupidAndDummy: A dumb raider is fighting against a dummy.
session_synopses.AD_PackingTraders: Lim and Meli are packing away the valuables they've scored..
session_synopses.Servant005: Arron, a druid trader, is truly relieved that the player was able to help everyone. He didn't look forward to what would have happened otherwise.
session_synopses.HarpyKid: A kid in a protected area - think like a bunker during the blitz - waiting for an attack to come. Somebody has been telling him and his friends stories to distract them from what's coming. He looks up to the player because he saved him before.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted. This kid is only present if player saved them from their snake death.
session_synopses.Pet003: The bird returns to the Den after the tieflings win.
session_synopses.MindMeldAfterCombat: A drow commander telepathically communicates with players who have allied with her to slaughter the inhabitants of a druid's grove
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Attack on Den state.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan (the prodigy) reacts to the successful defence of the grove, in the event that he was convinced to stay.
session_synopses.Mule2: Ox dialogue during and after the den gets raided by goblins.
session_synopses.AD_CoweringRefugee003: Player has turned on the tiefligns and is coming after them!
session_synopses.AD_CoweringRefugee002: Triggered when goblins break in to slaughter unarmed civilians.
session_synopses.Tiefling003: Cook - losing prospect at prospect of enduring a siege.
session_synopses.Kid004: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted.
session_synopses.ScoutCaptive: A druid we've saved twice from goblins thanks us after a major attack. This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove.
session_synopses.SonOfChef: This is Ikaron's solo dialogue. It occurs in the Attack on Den state. It can occur after his dual dialogue with Okta or if the player spoke to him before triggering that scene.
session_synopses.AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend: Memnos is outraged after the player betrays the refugees in favour of the attacking goblins.
session_synopses.WarchiefGrumpy: Goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingOnGate: Arka talks to herself while manning the Grove's defences, working herself up for the imminent battle against attacking goblins. She mentions her dead friend Kanon and all the goblins she intends to kill in his name.
session_synopses.Pet002: After victory following a huge goblin attack on his home, a wolf feels satisfied with a job well done, but warns you not to ruin the peace..
session_synopses.AD_HalsinJoinsFight: AD that plays when Halsin joins the fight against the goblin raiders, after the player betrays the tieflings.
session_synopses.Servant004: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Elwyn is shaken - she's spent a long time worried about the safety of the grove, and had given up hope once the goblins arrived. After the goblins were defeated, she realises her fear had gotten the better of her.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions: Mol is looking over the valuables that have been gathered by her underlings and advises them as they prepare to journey to Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.TorturedAdventurer: Oneliner when we find the tortured adventurer sleeping in the grove during the attack on the den.
session_synopses.AD_LairDoor: The person behind the locked druid sanctum door (Marcoryl the druid servant) yells at Doni (grunting kid) to get lost.
session_synopses.RitualDruid002: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Kerrick feels ashamed for having participated in a ritual that would have driven the tieflings out, especially after having just fought beside them against the goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Prodigies: The prodigy and his brother and sister are having an argument about their role in the defense of the grove.
session_synopses.Sapper_003: a goblin carrying explosives in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAtBarricade: Asharak is on the gate with Kaldani, before the goblins attack. Surveying her work..
session_synopses.Trainer:
Asharak has been tasked with getting civilians prepared for war. He hopes having the player on their side might make the difference.
If the tiefling leader is dead, Asharak reluctantly steps into his shoes.
session_synopses.Trainee003: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.RaiderBossy: A goblin raider celebrates upon having successfully destroyed a shelter full of refugees. Jubilant and nasty.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: Kagha dialogue if Attack on Den has occurred. Various states included in this dialogue
session_synopses.PAD_DeadKids: Player finds dead tiefling children, killed by goblins, after assisting the goblins in a raid on the grove. NOTE: this dialog only triggers if players chose to side against the tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_LootingGoblins: Two goblins are looting the area near the cook and adventurer areas before burning it to the ground.
session_synopses.EntranceMeeting: Zevlor or Asharak are manning the wall of the grove, which is sealed up tight against a coming invasion. They're astonished to see an ally (the player) emerge from the trees and order their soldiers not to shoot.
session_synopses.Griefling: A tiefling preparing for the goblin assault on the grove - she's scared but excited about the attack because she sees it as a chance to avenge her friend, Kanon, who was killed by goblins earlier. She's trying to sound more sure of herself than she is.
session_synopses.RaiderViolent: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid001: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Aelar is still in a bit of a daze from chanting for so long. He doesn't quite believe everything that's happened.
session_synopses.RaiderHardy: A goblin taking part in a raid on a druid grove
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: Dialogue for the lazy bear sleeping next to the elevator after the den has been attacked.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefAndPotions: The warchief sees through the arsonists who failed to loot the storehouse and orders them to get to looting despite the fire.
session_synopses.EntranceMeetingWyll: Player returns to den after letting Wyll return beforehand. NOTE: A NARRATOR NODE IS REQUIRED IN THE FIRST NODE BECAUSE IT IS A SPEAKER SELECTION WITH A CINEMATIC.
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove, in the event that the prodigy and co were convinced to stay.
session_synopses.RaiderCrafty: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is shocked by the slaughter of the battle that just happened and wants to leave.
session_synopses.AD_RaidersAtPool: Raiders are having a pissing competition by the water close to the sacred grove.
session_synopses.LeaderKid: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.
session_synopses.AD_CaringForOx: During the goblin attack. Trying to keep the ox calm.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove in instances where she was convinced to stay around.
session_synopses.AD_RikkaAndDoni: Rikka found Doni, so they can go hide together before the goblin attack.
session_synopses.ChefAndSon: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.GoblinLush: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_BossyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll dialogue if he is an NPC and is in the goblin camp after attack on den victory. In paths where the attack has yet to begin, Wyll is enthusiastic for you to blow the horn and call for battle. After battle, you can recruit Wyll.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: Young child is hustling and trying to trade with player on the eve of a battle.
session_synopses.RaiderStupid: Gobin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Mule1: A speak with animals dialogue where the player can commune with an ox and get a sense of their feelings during and after an attack on the Druid Grove - fear, confusion or elation depending on who wins the fight.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: Rikka is a civilian caught up in the battle at the grove, She is scared, but initially distracted by the search for an eccentric little boy she needs to get to safety before sealing up a hideout.
session_synopses.Apprentice: |Dialog used:- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)- after Goblin Hunt|
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonPacking: Ikaron is trying to lift a heavy crate to load onto a cart with Okta packing by his side.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: She's the gatekeeper at the Druid Grove and speaks these lines before and after a goblin attack that threatens to kill everyone in the place. She's shaken and extremely surprised and relieved to have survived
session_synopses.AD_CoweringStargazer: Goblins have just broken in and started killing unarmed civilians around Nadira.
session_synopses.BackupVictory: Cerys is addressing a crowd of her people after a battle in which their leaders died. She's taken it on herself to take the lead, despite being uncomfortable with the duty..
session_synopses.Trainee001: A child who's been trained to fight - terrified and in denial at the fact that he may just have to.
session_synopses.RaiderBold: goblin raider involved in attack on the druid grove
session_synopses.Sapper_001: goblin with an explosive barrel, participating in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: The tiefling weaponsmith is arming the others defending the den and checking their gear.
session_synopses.RaiderCunning: A goblin participating in a large raid on a druid grove - these lines are spoken during and after the fight
session_synopses.AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin is speaking with Kagha until the players arrive for a scene. This dialog varies whether Kagha turned good or conflict with tieflings wasn`t resolved - it can be tense or reconciliary.
session_synopses.AD_LoversOverTortured: Danis and Bex are a couple tending to the wounded adventurer while waiting for the attack to begin.
session_synopses.Tiefling010: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.
session_synopses.RaiderFunny: A goblin taking part in an attack on a group of civilians, hiding in a refuge
session_synopses.RaiderChieftain: goblin raider involved in the attack on the grove - some lines before the attack, one in the aftermath
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate: Memnos and Arka express relief upon surviving the attack on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RaiderHefty: A goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Servant001: Ilderin spent the attack locked in a bunker and we're speaking to her after successfully defeating the goblins. Despite having been saved by us, she is pious and unwelcoming.
session_synopses.AD_PotionRaiders: Two raiders are raiding Ethel's supplies and drinking random potions.
session_synopses.Melee_001: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.AD_Sappers: Three goblin sappers (with explosives) are bored after a fight
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper: Small talk between Asharak and Elegis at the gate. They're both frightened and looking for distraction.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriend: Memnos prays to any god who might listen as the grove he's sheltering prepares to face an onslaught of goblin attackers.
session_synopses.ParentA: Parent is hiding away in the refuge, awaiting the attack.
session_synopses.Refugee001: Refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove. She has become numb, resigned to her fate.
session_synopses.AD_GettingArmed: Guex is telling some reluctant non-combatant tieflings to arm themselves for the road ahead. He speaks while looking over them picking through a pile of weapons.
session_synopses.WarchiefBrave: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees
session_synopses.TieflingLeader: Zevlor is tense - he's awaiting a long-expected attack on the grove, and the player is likely here to confirm it or perhaps even strike the first blow against him. Zevlor's usual tone is all stiff upper-lip, but at certain points we'll see the cracks start to form.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, one of the druid grove's guards, reacts to their victory in defending their home. She may also react to the tiefling refugees having left.
session_synopses.Ranged_001: The goblins have just won a bloody victory over innocent civilians.
session_synopses.AD_CraftyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.AD_CharmedKidStory: Mirkon is a fallback, telling a story if the bard isn't present. He's excitedly telling the story about how he got caught by the harpies and the player rescued him.
session_synopses.PAD_LairDoorBlocked: The door to the druid's lair is blocked. Player can't get inside to help people get in.
session_synopses.Tiefling007: A novice guard who's brash and eager to fight. He's either guarding the wall or filling barrels of oil ahead of the fight.
session_synopses.AD_ApprenticeLastStand: The druid's apprentice prepares to make her last stand against the player, who has betrayed her and the grove she swore to protect. She's shattered by the betrayal.
session_synopses.RaidersArriveBeforeFight:
Takes place immediately after the player blows the horn at the gates of the grove, beginning an attack on the refugees hiding there. The surviving tiefling leader rallies his troops, then the drow commander arrives with her retinue of goblins. She mind-melds with the player. She expects them - as True Souls - to betray the tieflings, and players must choose whether to side with her OR with the tieflings as the attack begins.

This is a huge fight and a decisive moment for the tieflings, the drow/goblins, AND the players.
session_synopses.HalsinReturns: The Druid Grove has been saved (because either the attacking force was repelled or its leaders were assassinated) and Halsin returns. He thanks the player and reacts to events that may have transpired in the grove during his absence. He's previously promised to help the player with their tadpole problem, but he defers this discussion until the next morning after the victory celebrations.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
2.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

session_synopses.2: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Lia and Rolan would never admit it, but they'd take an arrow for the other. Also stab each other. Not sure what'll come first.
Brother.context: NodeContext: You have broken up a fight between Lia and Rolan more times than you can count. You're tone is light and friendly as you joke with the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Thanks for cutting in - there might have been more than words if you hadn't.
Brother.context: NodeContext: A big friendly smile - you are the most genuine of the group

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.
session_synopses.Brother: This dialog occurs after the argument between Lia and Rolan that Cal attempted to mediate. It's light and friendly, and mainly a chance for the player to get to know Cal.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Mirkon
AfterHarpyEncounter.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering in fear (he's hunkering down, with his hands over his face/ears). Scripter note: Use the generic cower or some approximation for consistency with scripter animations.

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Player
AfterHarpyEncounter.text: They're gone. Are you all right?

AD_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
AD_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome isn't looking at the player, but in the direction the singing comes from.NodeContext: in awe, entranced. Trying not to disturb the singer.

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.text: CinematicNodeContext: Harpy flies in and perches menacingly on the rock, while she keeps singing
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpy flies in and perches menacingly on the rock, while she keeps singing

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.text: Yes, everything's gonna be fine... once I get there...

VB_FoundHarpyNest.speaker: Player
VB_FoundHarpyNest.text: A giant nest... let's see what we can find.
VB_FoundHarpyNest.context: NodeContext: They enter the nest and smell the offal the harpies left behind.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AfterHarpyEncounter: Non-critical path. The player has just saved the child from harpies that had enchanted and tried to eat him. He's shy and still scared.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.CharmedVictim_Wildshape: Non-critical path. Unless the player has snapped him out of it, the boy will be enchanted and wanting to get closer to the source of the song.
session_synopses.VB_FoundHarpyNest: VB when the player finds the Harpy's nest
session_synopses.AD_PlayerUncharmed: AD played when player wakes up from being charmed by the harpies.

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

VB_ReturnedToGrove.speaker: Player
VB_ReturnedToGrove.text: I was a slave when we were last here. I do not appreciate being reminded of that.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Kagha's a Shadow Druid. She means to convert the circle.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: A Shadow Druid? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Go on. Say it. You think I'm a monster.

Leader.speaker: Wyll
Leader.text: Monster? Too kind. A demon, more like.

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: You're protecting your own - sometimes cruelty is required.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: First, you stay silent. Then, you speak truth. To think an outsider could surprise me twice over.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Ugh. I'm never gonna hear the end of this.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: If I'd got that stupid idol, I'd be a hero.

KidFreed.speaker: Player
KidFreed.text: What kind of hero did you expect to be?

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: A heroic thief! Mum, Dad, Mol - they all would've been so impressed.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Mol said we had to do something, because the old folks weren't doing anything.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: They were talking when the druids were getting ready to throw us out.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Why can't we just stay until it's safe?

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: I have been so blind, that an outsider would show me the way of Silvanus.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: After all I've done, you've no reason to believe me, but... I'm grateful.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: I will cancel the rite and subject myself to the circle for judgement.

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Player
SelfReflection.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.KidFreed: |Arabella (Snake Kid) after she ran away from the druid lair.|
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.LeaderSaved: Kagha's dialog after the Celebration (post-AttackOnDen or post-GoblinHunt), if the scene with the parents occured and the player saved her.CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_Event_SavedKagha = true
session_synopses.SelfReflection: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.

AD_TieflingKid004.speaker: Zaki
AD_TieflingKid004.text: You're one of those toad-people Zorru saw!

PAD_AfterKid.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_AfterKid.text: This Zorru has encountered githyanki. I must find and question him.

session_synopses.AD_TieflingKid004: Tiefling kid recognises Lae'zel as a githyanki via AD
session_synopses.PAD_AfterKid: Lae'zel avatar remarks on the kid who recognised her as a githyanki

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tries to grab her, but she escapes their grasp.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: Drop the act. I know about your little scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: That hurts. It's a great big scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: But okay, fine. Get out of here. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A warrior like you could lift their spirits.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: Watch your bags, huh? Learn from my mistakes.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: I'll say this for those devils: they know how to throw a punch.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: My mum gave me that locket on her godsdamned deathbed. The boy took the thing. I know it.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo.text: Heirloom, is it? Been in your family long?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo.text: Not much of an heirloom then... unless there's a tale behind it, maybe?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: She stole it from a house she cleaned, all right?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: They didn't pay her much. They owed her a perk or two.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo.text: Let me get this straight - you're annoyed that somebody stole your stolen property?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: Ain't the same and you know it.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: Anyway, I meant what I said. Thanks for what you did. I gotta go.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Gan
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill so many goblins.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Challenging - "You can't be doing more than me!"

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill six hundred.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Adult chiming in as the children get distracted

AD_KidGuardReport.speaker: Mol
AD_KidGuardReport.text: Help! They're trying to kill us!

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.Adventurer_Solo: Non-critpath. Takes place after the player resolves the confronation between this adventurer and the thiefling boy who stole the adventurer's necklace.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: This place ain't so special. Why were the druids so protective of it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses.Protester3: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: Ugh, no matter. As long as I keep the damn thing safe.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking to herself, trying to figure out a mysterious artefact.

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart tries to figure out the mysterious cube that she carries with her while resting in the Druid Grove (the cube is a powerful relic that she was to retrieve deliver to her superiors - she does not know its exact nature, but has to protect it at all costs).

session_synopses.Dead: In this dialogue, Volo has died and is a lifeless corpse. Rather than his usual jocular self, he's a shade who can hardly speak.

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolStolen.text: The idol is gone. Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Kanon
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX: Death cry - While turning the wheel to open the gate, Kanon gets hit by an arrow in the neck and dies

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Remira
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX description: Heavy lifting efforts to try to keep gate open (along with Aradin & Barth). It's too heavy so the gate slams shut

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolStolen: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been stolen. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

PAD_FirstInsight.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstInsight.text: I'd swear that ox's gaze is following me.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstInsight: The player walks past and, if they notice (pass an insight check), responds to the ox looking at them strangely.
session_synopses.AD_OxReaction: This AD plays after you have spoken with the ox with SwA, if you linger or pass by the ox again.

HalsinDiedBearform.speaker: Narrator
HalsinDiedBearform.text: *The corpse before you is no longer that of a bear, but an elf - albeit a large one. Curious.*

session_synopses.HalsinDiedBearform: If Halsin is killed in bear form in the Wolf Pens and the party knew about Halsin, the companions comment on the fact that the large dead elf who can turn in to a bear was probably the druid they were sent to find. Oops.

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: How you doing, pal? Looking for some odds and ends? I've scavenged all sorts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly, like a cheeky bloke at a market selling stolen goods

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see you grubbing around here in the muck and the leftovers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where are the rest of the goblins?

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: On their way to Moonrise, with her ladyship. They left me here to make sure we ain't left nothing valuable behind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

session_synopses: After Goblin Hunt Celebration night and persuading Minthara to spare their lives, player can observe Goblin camp being empty with only one goblin trader looting what's rest in the Festivities area.This is that goblin's dialog.

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_01: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

session_synopses.WolfPens_AD_WorgOutsideCage: AD which is played when the worgs are outside the cage

AD_Goblin_001_Combat.speaker: Warrior Sul
AD_Goblin_001_Combat.text: Bet them guts are nice and juicy!

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: There are many memories I wish I could erase from my mind - the stench of this place is chief among them.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Oh no. No. Why ain't I petrified?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Panic as you realise the petrification - the thing keeping a deadly disease from spreading across your body - is gone.

Victim_001.speaker: Player
Victim_001.text: You don't sound pleased. Would you rather be a statue?

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I - I have the Bite. Laduguer's Bite.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease - admitting it with worry and shame.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: How... how am I still breathin'?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead.text: How did you end up in the cave?

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: Trapped... between two choices... I made a deal... to see my fate...

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: ... but all I saw... was death... so I ran... ran here...

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

VB_EnteredGallery.speaker: Player
VB_EnteredGallery.context:
NodeContext: Creeped out and horrified as you enter a 'gallery' of the hag's victims.
Shadowheart: droll.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Mustn'tlook. Mustn'tsee.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Musn'tlook. Musn'tsee.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting on the ground, knees up, hands moving from across knees to face as you rocking back and forth, severely traumatised and trying to hide from the worldNodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. This is quite a disturbing scene - you're clearly traumatised but trying to hold it together initially. Speaking and muttering to yourself (the image you are trying not too look at is your own corpse - rotten and broken), You are not looking at the player.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: I see it - what's to come.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Shot of mirror.  His reflection stares back.|NodeContext: Quickly muttered - not looking at player.

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of the fight - the player has figured out which illusion is the real you and hit you. You're PISSED. Furious at the player, yelping in pain for one of them, and roaring at the player for the others. Furious, vengeful and MAD.

ControlledByMask.text: Stay with me, petal. Stay with Auntie. Forever.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

PAD_Explore2.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore2.text: The work of the hag. No doubt about it.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.VB_EnteredGallery: Triggers as you enter the hag gallery. It's creepy.
session_synopses.Victim_003:
This victim was cursed to see the future by the hag. In his initial dialogue, he is SEVERELY traumatised - sitting down, knees up, peeking out between his arms. He should sound quite disturbed, as if his sanity has long since deserted him.

He doesn't look at the player until halfway through the dialogue. When he looks up, he believes the player to be a monster of nightmares - a mindflayer. This is a terrifying moment for the player, as they are fighting a parasite in their head that will cause them to turn into a mindflayer.

In his dialogue in which he's met the player but has survived the hag, his gift is gone - but once he realises the player is the monster he saw before, he runs - terrified. 

In his post hag dialogue he is saddened and clearly traumatised by his time with the hag - and the thought of the life he could have led.
session_synopses.AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.
session_synopses.ControlledByMask: Hag mode. Player has failed a wisdom save while wearing the mask and the hag has taken over their mind. Cruel and triumphant. The other origin characters realise what has happened.
session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore2: Players are wandering around the Hag Lair and have gotten into her workshop. It is filled with blood and bones. The hag may or may not be alive at this point.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I'm so stupid. How could I have trusted her?
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Shake and horrified - you've just survived a near death experience.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I almost gave that monster my child.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: The true horror of what you almost did is dawning on you - giving your child to a hag.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: It was part of the deal. For him.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Horror and grief as you recount your deal

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: My husband. She was going to bring him back. Bring Connor back to life.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: Your husband must have meant a great deal to you.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: Connor would have done anything to save me - I had to do the same.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I just wanted everything back - back the way it was.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Crying, covering your face in your hands - you hate crying in front of others but this is you at your lowest

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: That doesn't excuse the deal you made.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I never said it did! I just wanted you to understand.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Lair: This occurs after the hag fight. Mayrina is in one of two states. In the top she is horrified, shaken and trying to calm herself. She can't believe she almost made a deal with the hag and explains her deal to the player.In the second, she is FURIOUS with the player for ruining her deal. And leaves angry with them (unless you tell her about ethel planning to eat her child.)

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.
