ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Hold on. Where are the raiders?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Is it true, what Saz says? You helped her escape that grove?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. Genuine inquiry, but he's disinclined to believe you.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Quiet type, eh? Good. Keep outta trouble, or you and Saz'll get it.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: e's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza to Olak. 'Shut up and let us in.'

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Guard003.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Fallback node. RElatively friendly!

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Player
Backup002.text: Sounds like a bloody scrap. Where did you see that?

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: You ain't hear? We sacked Waukeen's Rest and left it to burn.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: Drow flingin' magic, gnolls snappin' off heads. Inn's nothin' but a pile of ash by now.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Worg_002.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002.text: Good smell. Pack smell. Smell like papa. Papa?
Worg_002.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the shit on your face. Quick, primal - as if looking for comfort.

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, not drowNodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Unless you got another reason to be here, feck-shite.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player. Dripping with disdain.

Guard001.speaker: Gale
Guard001.text: Let's try to be diplomatic, shall we? Goblins don't come by the handfuls, but by the dozens.

Guard001.speaker: Narrator
Guard001.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Beautiful animal. Does she belong to the Nordiland worgata family?

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: NodeContext: He's impressed. He's a worg expert so your knowledge appeals to him, but he doesn't want to make it too easy for you.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Dumb as a rock, but world class at tearin' the throats outta wee ones, she is.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Rest of her litter's inside, in the pens. Beautiful beasts.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: I've never seen a pack up close - always wanted to.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Be a shame if you came all this way without havin' a look. But I can't let you pass just like that.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Celebratin' a raid, we are. You'll need to wear our war colours.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Said greasily. He's playing a trick on the player.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Nice dab o' this across the mug oughta do it.
Guard001.context: CinematicNodeContext: *He pointed to a steaming pile of worg dung at his feet.*NodeContext: Pointing to worg shit as he says this. Stifling an evil laugh. He's told the player to smear shit in their face.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Scoop up the warm dung and fling it at Olak's face.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: Can flinging dung at Olek make him go blind for combat?NodeContext: Player threw dung in Olak's eyes. This leads to combat.

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
session_synopses.Guard003: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.
session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Worg_002: An attack beast used to mistreatment stands guard with its masters. Fearful, vengeful beast.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.
session_synopses.Guard001:
All guards at the checkpoint point the player to the guard with this dialog. He is an evil, nasty character who has no reason to go easy on the player. Should ooze disdain. This is the first goblin we meet and their weasly, cruel, wicked nature should stand out.
The goblin will let a non-allied player in only if they smear worg shit on their face. Yuck.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Sweet child. While I enjoyed that, I'm afraid your reaction was... lacking.
RewardPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice low and intimate. Player did penance but did not react correctly. He regrets that the player does not get a reward (but he had a great time, which is all he really cares abotu)

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: To gain Loviatar's favour, every single strike should be met with an honest cry of pain - or perhaps a touch of begging.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Nevertheless, thank you. And I pray you've learned from today's little... lesson.

session_synopses.RewardPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.

Branding.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding.text: Ready to figure out what's goin' on with those shadows in your head?

session_synopses.Branding:
The sadistic goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

 She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's cruel and has a sense of superiority over her own kind. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

Ball.speaker: Narrator
Ball.text: *The chicken's head bobs, eyes darting around at the leering goblin faces. She's terrified.*
Ball.context: NodeContext: Appealing directly to the player for help. Hoping anyone will save her.

Ball.speaker: Narrator
Ball.text: *She meets your eye, and the fear there hardens into rage. She gathers herself.*
Ball.context: NodeContext: Desperately angry and afraid - but determind to attack the goblins and peck their eyes out.

session_synopses.Ball: This chicken is being used as the 'ball' in a goblin sport. The goblins chase it around an enclosure, trying to make it run between two posts so that they can score a 'goal'. It's exhausted and frightened.
session_synopses.GameOver: The Chase is over, the commentator tells the player to approach her.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: 'Ere - you 'eard about wot happened on that last raid? Right so, some slob 'ad the drop on me...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eager to tell this story to anyone who'll listen

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: Then she falls flat on 'er face with an arrow in 'er back! That's the Absolute that is. Protectin' me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud

session_synopses: Goblin telling a war-story in which he conflates blind luck with "the will of God".

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't polite to stare, worm-wart. If you ain't got the guts to get branded, clear off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why would I let anyone scar me for life?

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't just a mark on the flesh: it's magic. Only them what follows the Absolute can see it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: as if trying to explain something obvious to an idiot

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Let's us know you're on our side. That way, nobody'll mess with ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining something simple, talking down to us a little

session_synopses: Newly-converted goblin is eager to talk about the virtues of the  the Absolute. He's full of religious zeal and relative good cheer, which is amplified if he finds the players are on the same side. Or pretending to be.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Let me see what you have.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: Sorry - I don't want any trouble.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin000.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
DwarfOperator000.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator000.text: They look quite fetching on you.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: You find the ones who poisoned that beer, you bring 'em to me. I'll take their heads for free.

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: Poisonin' the only good thing in this dump...
Bugbear_Wanderer.context: NodeContext: grumbled, not really to the player.

Goblin003.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003.text: Wass holdin' up the game? Chicken ain't dead is it?

Goblin004.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Player
Goblin005.text: You'll need to sober up before another raid.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Tha's wot I said! Too sozzled for slicin' folks.
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have the player's support

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: I'd sleep it off in the worg pens... but that place is a madhouse right now.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin000: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Wanderer: A very grumpy bugbear guard who'd rather be sleeping.
session_synopses.Goblin003: This goblin is a spectator - initially of a bard singing a song in which he's not partcularly interested, and later of a game of chicken chase
session_synopses.Goblin004: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Watcha standing 'ere all dry fer? C'mere, have a drink!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin waves the player over and holds out a drink. (she should be holding two cups, one in each hand). The player isn't on the cage yet.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: What should we toast to, eh?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player isn't on the cage yet,

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm glad you asked. Tell everyone to gather round...

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Guys! This 'un's givin' us a toast!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player teleported next to the goblin. She should turn to the left to address the other goblins. The other goblins go and refill their beer.NodeContext: The goblin is calling over the other goblins standing around.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You raise your glass and shout...*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: To Myrkul, lord of bones!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The goblins blink at you in confusion.*
NodeContext: Do not record.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Do not record.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Go on, drink up!
node_data.context: NodeContext: good-natured.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Spill the beer, then pretend to drink from the empty cup.
False

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Hey! That's our beer you're wastin'! Ain't good enough for ya?
node_data.context: NodeContext: a little surprised and a little angry.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
node_data.text: You think there's somethin' wrong with it?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin is looking into their cup.NodeContext: aside to another goblin. a little distrustful

node_data.speaker: Warlock Gurk
node_data.text: I told ya we shouldn't be drinkin' the foam. It ain't right.
node_data.context: NodeContext: aside to another goblin.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Wait, 'ave ya been tamperin' with our beer? That what ye've been standin' 'round 'ere for?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Starting to get suspicious

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You caught me. It's poisoned.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: I shoulda known! Get 'em!

session_synopses: A goblin comes up to you after you've poisoned the beer and gives you a glass of newly poisoned alcohol, proposing a toast. She's standing on a cage (about 2m high) together with the player.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
node_data.text: Don't let our little pet scare ya, mate. Bloody bugbear couldn't break those bars.

session_synopses: Goblin is telling player of the captive they've placed in the wolf pens.

SpottedHostilePlayer.text: You! I remember you from the forest. You should never have come here.
SpottedHostilePlayer.context: NodeContext: They are hostile toward you and will fight you after htis line.

session_synopses.SpottedHostilePlayer: Priests of Conquering God can become hostile in FOR. If player leaves combat, priests still apear at Goblin Camp. This dialog happens if they spot a hostile player just to show player the reason why the whole camp suddenly becomes hostile.

node_data.speaker: Narvass
node_data.text: Silence. You'll interrupt the ritual.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's watching a ritual, trying not to disturb it.NodeContext: stern, but not too loud - he doesn't want to interrupt the ritual himself.

session_synopses: Watching the goblin king perform the Speak with Dead spell.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Clack
node_data.text: If yer close enough to talk with me, then yer too damn close.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Busy sharpening spears, a bit brusque.

session_synopses: Impatient goblin sharpening his spears while guarding a heretical goblin. A bit of an attitude to this one.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: Another outsider come to see the boss?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing the player up - sounds bored of all the newcomers

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: Mind yer manners, now - or he'll throw ya in the pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking, warning - he'd love to throw you in

session_synopses: A goblin who guards a pit of giant spiders. To most players, he's rude, but to drow he's deferential and grovels, trying to please them.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You know Maglubiyet - deity of the goblinoids, hungry for blood and conquest.*

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking advice

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Spiders and worgs are nothing. I can handle myself.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: If you 'ad 'alf a brain, you wouldn't be muckin' around in 'ere at all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: advising

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They've all gone barmy - 'ad their 'eds turned from the old ways by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining the situation, frustrated

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
node_data.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed

session_synopses: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Seen this mess? Flamin' Fist thuggo took a chunk outta me arm last raid out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's holding her arm up to playerNodeContext: Speaks to the player slightly more as an equal - they've been accepted into the camp thus far, after all. She's displaying a nasty wound

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You fought Flaming Fist?

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: That last inn we 'it. They were guardin' some uppity noble 'n his friends.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost bored at the story - she's describing an incident of great significance to you but she only cares about the fight and the spoils it brings

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Not very well, mind. Drow carried him off, left the real spoils to us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive. Both of the mercenaries who couldn't put up a fight, and of the fact that the drow only cared about taking hostages, leave the real valuables (in her eyes) behind

session_synopses: Non crit-path. This goblin is recounting stories of her last raid and displaying a wound. It's less a cause of pain than a subject for boasting.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Bez
node_data.text: Unless you like big, bristlin' hairy legs, I wouldn't go down there, mate. Tha's the spider pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Terrified of the spiders she's guarding. Acts very deferential with the drow, but is honest about her fear with other races.

session_synopses: This guard is watching over a pit containing two giant spiders. She is afraid of them and says as much to the player (unless player is a drow, who venerate spiders)

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You been out there spillin' blood for the Absolute?
node_data.context: NodeContext: appraising the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Indeed, by the bucket.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Smashin'! Wish you was part of my mob.
node_data.context: NodeContext: delighted

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Carve a mark on the next one you drop so's everyone knows who's in charge around here!
node_data.context: NodeContext: malicious glee

session_synopses: Sober goblin, tough, itching for a fight.

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: There! That's the last frothing innard catalogued.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Best not to hang around. Whoever is responsible for this mess may still be here... unless this was your doing?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: polite advice on first sentence, and then a warning. The final phrase is a mixture of curiosity and awe

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: You? Why? And how? But wait, wait - let me get a fresh quill. Now. You were saying?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Never mind. What are you doing here anyway - looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Just nosing out the facts. Something happened here, and it's my job - my calling - to discover what.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: arrogant - his 'calling' (at this moment, asking annoying questions) is the most important thing in the world as far as he sees it

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: But if you won't tell me, no matter. A truth is second best to the truth.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: journalistic type who is more interested in a good story than a true story

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Hmmm... Your story may be relevant, but the stench of this place is hardly suited to civilised conversation.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: politely trying to tag along with the players

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I wonder if we might continue this elsewhere. You've a brain I'd like to pick.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Pick a different brain. I can't help you.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I'll be no trouble, my friend. Name a location and I'd be happy to meet you there.

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

session_synopses.Volo_Massacre: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The eye's glassy black surface reflects your gaze.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: the 'eye' is large, magical and floating around watching you

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you gaze deeper, you feel a focus. An intent.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: this 'intent' is unnerving

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach out to the presence.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel a brief, lurching connection. The sensation of falling into your own image, endlessly.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: unnerving

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Confusion. Alarm. Then the presence withdraws - leaving a dull black mirror once more.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: urgency and mystery - the 'dull black mirror' is the surface of the crying eye

session_synopses: The scrying eye is a floating eye that acts as a sort of magical security camera. This one is hovering around the goblin camp spying on players and broadcasting back to Moonrise Towers. The presence watching is a drow at moonrise.

Caster_01.speaker: Erna
Caster_01.text: You don't want to go in there. Really.
Caster_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, more serious. The previous warning was an attempt to be friendly, but we're pushing our luck now and the humour's gone.

session_synopses.Caster_01: This mercenary is guarding the entrance to a supply of incredibly rare and explosive material. She's trying to strike a more reasonable tone than the other guard we speak to.

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.

session_synopses.SlowDown_NoGoblins: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely after they apply a brake. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oi! What's the bloody ruckus out there?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and on-guard - she's heard a great deal of noise outside and you, a stranger, have just stumbled in

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll be asking the questions.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oh! B-beg pardon, True Soul! At y'service, of course.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Alarmed - she's just spoken sharply to someone who can kill her without a second thought.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: This goblin guard is aggressive and self-important. She's been tasked with keeping drunkards out and is taking to her small responsibility like a little tyrant, but will immediately roll over if the player convinces her of their authority.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
node_data.text: Ain't you got sumfin' better to do?
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin who doesn't have a lot of respect or time for players who are bothering her while she's trying to mingle with her fellow raiders

node_data.speaker: Devout Cry
node_data.text: Boss put ya to work, eh?

session_synopses: Goblin observer part of ritual. Wants you to be respectful of the king.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbUp: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Underdark to the Goblin Camp

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.
session_synopses.Rat_000: Rat in the torture cell who is starving because all the prisoners have been carted away.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Hmph.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He waves you off, while he keeps looking at the goblin boss.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It'll be a very short lifetime if you don't hand me the manuscript.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Bloody hell - an' people say goblins are savage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid - we're bullying him

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: It ain't worth fightin' over. Take it!
node_data.context: NodeContext: upset afraid, we're bullying him

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Trespassing: This goblin is nearly blackout drunk and unsteady on his feet, but still trying to perform guard duties.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Hold up your hands to show you mean no harm.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.
session_synopses.Dead: SwD dialog for Crusher, an absolute legend (pun intended) among the goblin tribe.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Tozad
node_data.text: If yer plannin' to talk ta the drow, watch yerself - she's in a right mood.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous and deferential (when speaking to a drow) Insulting (when speaking to a Tiefling)  Friendly word of advice (if speaking to neither a drow or tiefling).

session_synopses: A female goblin grunt. Nervous and respectful to drow, insulting towards tieflings. World-weary and advisory to others.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: The ringleaders of these butchers still draw breath. Nobody is safe until we stop them.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: Hurry, please. Any delay could cost innocents' lives.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

Kid_001.speaker: One
Kid_001.text: D'you think it's bad to keep throwing stones at a dead lump?
Kid_001.context: NodeContext: curious, a bit naughty. She doesn't think it's bad at all.

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Worg_002.speaker: Tale
Worg_002.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following_Elf: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his elf form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Kid_001: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Worg_002: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute: Before entering the goblin camp, a scene triggers in which the party hear the voice of the Absolute, and experience a vision of its Chosen Three (Ketheric, Gortash and Orin). The voice orders the player to help the three find the Orpheus artefact and to seek 'the path of illumination'.If a party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory, they take it into their hands. It glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice and visions stop. The light from the box then fades, and the player(s) discuss the apparent protection the box provided from the Absolute’s influence.If no party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory,and Shadowheart isn't alive to show up, the visions and voice will cause the party to pass out and experience a forced camp night where they receive the box.NOTE: this dialogue contains narrator nodes that're intended to be player-forward in the medium term until NPC assets are available for cinematics.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Stop, STOP!
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a loud, panicked whisper.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Bibberbang!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Motions to the mushrooms surrounding him, then mimes 'blowing up'.NodeContext: A warning of nearby danger

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Bibber-what? Speak plainly, won't you?

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: These mushrooms - toxic!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Scroll - escape! My bag! Please. I've dropped it - somewhere!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This is your mess - figure it out yourself.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Bloody drow!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a drow/dark elf abandoning him to his fate.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: I-I mean... I didn't mean that.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Backpedalling on his previous insult - he still needs help.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Please - can't... can't get out...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dejected and worried.

session_synopses: Baelan, a mushroom hunter,  is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.
session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Thanks for sharing. I'll keep it in mind.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: Why would you think I'm a True Soul?

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: The stench - all you Twat-Souls got one. Some of us got a nose for it.

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.Mutineers_GroupFollowUp: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

session_synopses.CINE_FromPLA: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using an elevator to get from the Zhentarim Hideout to the Underdark

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.
session_synopses.CINE_PowerCutscene: This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc.This dialog can be easily triggered from console with    SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Fah. Thought I'd have to breathe my last in Nere's stink.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful. Breathless.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I'm grateful, don't mistake me, but... why help us? You're one of them, aren't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Guarded, sizing the player up - he thinks we're one of the cultists

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You say you're grateful - but my coinpurse is still light.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: You did just lift a mountain from our heads, so... good enough for me, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nodding, accepting - not going to look a gift horse in the mouth

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Here - the Ironhand Gnomes honour their debts. With Wulbren gone, that falls to me.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'handing reward' animation.NodeContext: Drawing himself up to perform a necessary obligation - doesn't see himself as leadership material but accepts the responsibility

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Make it quick! We need to find Wulbren - now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who's Wulbren?

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: The leader of our expedition. He was sent off to Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We were just slave-hands to the cult, but not Wulbren. He... knows things. Things they want to know too.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to say exactly what Wulbren knows

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What has he gotten himself mixed up in now...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Before you ask, no - I'm not going to stage a rescue.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Aye. Nor us, I'm afraid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: shrugging, a little defeated. This line trails off into another 'Much as I want to march after Wulbren myself... we can't.'

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We have our own freedom to look to, I'm afraid. We'll take our chance when it arises, then back to the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: His people are still enslaved - he needs to be pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Wulbren knew the risks when he came in search of runepowder. We all did.

session_synopses: The gnome leader's main dialogue. He thanks you for saving them, and tells you what brought his people to the Underdark to begin with - an expedition led by their charismatic leader Wulbren, to find a forgotten gnomish explosive of awesome power - runepowder.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Pull Nere from the rubble. Time Nere gets what's coming.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.AD_FishChanting: Fanatical chanting at the altar of a murder god, a crowd heard from afar rather than direct dialogue. This dialog has no lines that are spoken by the character - the lines are intended to be subtitles for the SFX
session_synopses.PAD_MagicGone: This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

Boat.speaker: Narrator
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: ~Should share sequence with *A vessel wobbles on the lake's murky waters.*

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: First time using the boat, sailing to the camp

Boat.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player departs from the Myconid beach and pilots the raft out into the underground lake
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]
Boat.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player departs from the Myconid beach and pilots the raft out into the underground lake
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: Godsdamned dwarf. What are you doing on Gekh's raft?

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: Duergar, like you? Saw his body a way back. Myconids got him.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: What a load of rothé shite. No way a mushroom killed Gekh.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.Boat: Raft dialogue. The player can decide either to sail somewhere or to walk away from the raft.
session_synopses.RaftEvent: The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.Dead_Wizard: SwD with Dhourn (leader of the petrified Drow).You can learn from this dialog about:- Forge- Memory Crystal and Activation Word for it;- Xagrism (one of his frenemies)

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Thrinn don't believe in mixing work between us and you. No, I think you were trying to escape.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: What do we do with runaways, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said as a threat, since htis is about ot start combat.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.
session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

FourWay.speaker: Narrator
FourWay.text: *These spiders aren't wild - they've been raised by local duergar and are fiercely loyal to them.*

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Try to discern the nature of their chatter.

FourWay.speaker: Narrator
FourWay.text: *They appear to be in conflict - the larger spider versus the other three.*

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Stand back and see how things play out.

session_synopses.FourWay: In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth.Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal.This dialogue has 2 outcomes:AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine)PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new.Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grab the sword with both hands and pull.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It feels like you're warring with ten people for the blade, but with another hard yank, the weapon slips free from the stone.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: character struggles with sword, but eventually pulls it out. what a feat of strength!

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

session_synopses.AtPier_02: Gruff duergar guard standing watch ovre the entrance to Ketheric City.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: What? No. Lunkbug, you can't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do what I can.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Please, please don't hurt my Phil, I beg you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Worried you will hurt her beloved.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hurry. Our people won't last in that cave-in forever.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

Saved.speaker: Skickpit
Saved.text: Shit. Still can't believe you got me out of there. Sorry I told you to piss off.

session_synopses.Saved: Foul-mouthed elevator gnome has been saved and is now in the myconid circle.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Looking into the hole, you see only darkness. It's impossible to tell how deep it goes by sight alone.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hellooo?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your call echoes as it plunges downward, before gradually fading away.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The call echoes down the hole.

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the growl of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Wizard.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

session_synopses.Squad_Wizard: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: You had our backs. Guess you True Souls ain't all bad.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: I mean, still don't like ya. But you're not a total gobshite. Bah. You buying?
Camp.context: NodeContext: Said roughly but with a tough of affection. 'Bah' cause greymon doesn't like talking about FEELINGS.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.context: NodeContext: Gruff but pleased. Greymon thinks better of the player.

session_synopses.Camp: Default dialog for the captain of the raft at the duergar camp. In default state, he encourages you to talk to the sergeant, as he has already told you to do that in previous dialogue.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *The head breaks off cleanly from the drow's body.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face as they finish decapitation, stow knife. Raise head to inspect it.

session_synopses.NereHeadLoot: After the drow Nere dies, the players have the option to cut off his head if they are on a Myconid Revenge quest. If they fail the Strength check, the player makes a mess of it and the party gets splattered.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *You see nothing special - just torn and faded velvet tunics.*

session_synopses.Looted_Solo: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

AD_BeckonPlayer.text: To me! I shall guide thee.

AD_FailedWisdomSave.text: A burden, mine blessing can also be. So sorry. Ho ho HO!

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.
