session_synopses.AD_FailedWisdomSave: After resting and leaving camp, the haunted amulet curses the player with periodic fits of laughter if they use the amulet's ability  if they do not pass a wisdom save. Amulet speaks this dialogue. Shar-allied clerics and paladins get different lines: the amulet is happy to drive them mad.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Dunnol
node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is shouting at the gnomes.

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You sense Nere's frustration, tinged with rage, as the connection fades.*

node_data.speaker: Nere
node_data.text: Didn't I tell you to go to Moonrise Towers? The General must be told of my situation.

session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.
session_synopses: Dialogue with Nere after you fought the duergar with him and he sent you away either to find help in Moonrise or simply to leave him alone. His cold malice and zealotry should shine through.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Furious. How dare a wretched flower take what is yours?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic is gone, replaced by fury. You and your powers are one - this will be temporary.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You don't know what you've done. Leave me be.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Player cured Baelen. She's facing a terrible future.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I know exactly what I've done. Very entertaining.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You're a beast - you and Baelen  would make fine bedfellows.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Get out of my face. Find some else's suffering to lap up.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: If you're so eager for blood, Glut, then let me give it to you.

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Your mind is a canyon, and the words echo from every crevasse.*

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: I don't know who you are, but you're not welcome in my head.

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: What was your role in the circle?

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: ((*...to grow. to know. to be one with the Circle...*))

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

InjuredGnome_SporeServant.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_SporeServant.text: *It is not a gnome who stands before you, but a mere husk.*

InjuredGnome_SporeServant.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_SporeServant.text: *It stands quietly, awaiting its myconid master's command.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.text: *The monstrosity stares blankly. The voice that echoes within you belongs not to it, but the sovereign.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome_SporeServant: Player speaks with Thulla - the injured gnome, - after she dies from duergar poison and is resurrected by the myconids as a spore servant.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign_HookHorror: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: Beldron said we'll head back to the city. But the others at Moonrise...

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: ... I can't bear to think of it.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Laridda reflects on her missing friends, who are trapped in Moonrise.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: You tryin' to grab the adamantine back there for yourself?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: The metal and forge are the clan's - Laduguer's decree!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: Stand down. I'm not trying to take anything.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Empty words, jargh. Adamantine's precious, and I'm not the sharing type.

session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle is cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Duergar Leader. She could be dead either because of player, Nere (her superior) or gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: This ain't a show. Go make yourself useful or get lost.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

001.speaker: Ward Magmar
001.text: Shove off. Just 'cause you offed Nere doesn't mean I'm sharing.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.
session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor

AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe

AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate

AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

PAD_HealedOwlbear.speaker: Player
PAD_HealedOwlbear.text: Healed - but she doesn't look much happier.
PAD_HealedOwlbear.context: NodeContext: Karlach: 'I healed you, owlbear--> you still look like you're gonna rip my face off.'

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: That, or we've just prolonged its misery.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. Wondering if it would've been better to kill the animal.

VB_CubResolution_1P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_1P.text: Nature can provide for the cub. Perhaps it'll live.
VB_CubResolution_1P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub fend for itself.

CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: A lone cub isn't much of a threat...

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: Not without its mother by its side. What now?

session_synopses.PAD_HealedOwlbear: A short VB after player heals the Owlbear in gameplay. Owlbear is still dangerous, though. This can happen either before or after the player has interacted with Owlbear. It's meant to give feedback on the fact that the owlbear is now healed, but not to encourage the player to provoke her.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_2P: The party briefly reflects on their decision to spare or kill an orphaned owlbear cub.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_1P: The players comment briefly on their decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub live or not.
session_synopses.CMB_Enrage: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - in this dialogue specifically, she is enraged.Players encounter an owlbear mother and her cub in a cave. This dialogue plays if players smash her egg or kill her cub in front of her.
session_synopses.VB_LastCub: After killing an adult owlbear, combat ends as the player notes that the surviving owlbear cub doesn't pose much of a threat to them.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Look what we got here - another little birdie wantin' to fly!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player.NodeContext: Cruel bravado.The goblin sees the player approach and boldly announces it to his cronies - he thinks some fresh victims have just turned up.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Yehehueh! Flap those wings some more, an' I'll feed you a worm!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.NodeContext: Greatly amused. A schoolyard bully tormenting the little kid. Projecting his voice a little (Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.)
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: An' you - hope you got a stomach fer heights!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin turns back to the player (if the gnome inclusion line triggered - otherwise he's facing the player the whole time.)NodeContext: Confident, unpleasant. Turning his attention to the player to deliver a threat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not looking for trouble - just want to pass by.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Heh, funny. That's what our birdie wanted.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking. Refers to the player's previous statement ('I don't want trouble - just want to pass by').

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: ...Release me this instant, you beasts!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the deep gnome yells at his captors as he swings into earshotNodeContext: Panicked, angry. Issuing an ultimatum even though he has no means of following through on it.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: 'Less you wanna join him up there, you'd best pay the toll.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin looks at his hands and tries to calculate a figure with his fingers.NodeContext: Fezzerk mockingly refers to the deep gnome's predicament as he threatens the player. 'Passing by' refers to rotating on a windmill rather than safe passage through the area, in his book.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Cough it up! ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The idea is the goblin is a bit dim greedy and throwing out a stupidly high number.NodeContext: Fezzerk declares his price. (A ridiculously high sum - questionable whether he truly knows how absurd a demand this is)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm going to pay nothing, and you and your cronies are going to leave.
True

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Y-you're a True Soul... I didn't know. Wouldn't dare question you, never!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: We'll, erm, we'll leave you to it.

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grasp the handle and pull the dagger with all your might.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You tug at the dagger until the blade snaps in two. The sharp end is still stuck inside the meat.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

session_synopses.AD_MissingPoster: A faded poster of missing children in an abandoned village, indicating an earlier Dark Justiciar abduction.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin reacts to the decision to leave with slight disappointment.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you approach, a guttural scream and a succession of quick bangs rattle the door.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then a low moan. Someone - or something - is having a bit of fun.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the couple.

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!

session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Well, well, boys. Looks like we got ourselves a trespasser.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Oi! You just walked into the wrong town.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at playerNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Wait - a drow? In the sun?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Taken aback - this is bad news for them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Stand down! This one's got a touch of the Absolute about them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Apologies, your lordship. Hard makin' you out from a distance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It'll take more than an apology. Your head will suffice.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Y'know, no one said nothin' about a drow coming through.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Realising the player isn't on their side.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Meanin' you ain't one of us. Change of plans, lads! Kill 'em!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Excited to kill a drow, for once. Shouts the last bits to their comrades.

Warning.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Warning.text: More of our crowd inside, but we'll send word you're all right.
Warning.context: NodeContext: We've been let past a checkpoint, she's reassuring us we won't be attacked.

session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.Warning: Goblin warrior standing guard in the abandoned village - she's eager for a fight and slightly let down if we talk our way past.

PAD_NoticeShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeShrine.text: Over there - a shrine to Selûne. By Moonmaiden's grace.
PAD_NoticeShrine.context: NodeContext: Shar worshipper: notices the Selune shrine and makes a disdainful comment. Selune worshippers: notices the shrine and reacts with reverence.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.text: Chest's unlocked. My prayers are answered.
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a prayer unlocking a magically sealed chest.

session_synopses.PAD_NoticeShrine: The party comments on a little shrine they've discovered in a cavern - a grotto containing a statue and some prayers and offerings left by worshippers. Players may or may not recognise that the statue is the goddess Selûne. Shadowheart, as well as certain cleric/paladin tags, will recognise the statue always.
session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer: The player passes comment after they manage to open a magically sealed chest by reciting a prayer they found. If Shadowheart or a worshipper of Shar is speaking, the prayer does nothing.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome.speaker: Player
Tome.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

Goblin_02.speaker: Brawler Brek
Goblin_02.text: Hey... boss. Lots of your sort around these days.

AD_Boss.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_Boss.text: Gotta be somethin' in this heap.
AD_Boss.context: NodeContext: with disdain. isn't there anything interesting inthis shithole?

AD_Subordinates.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Subordinates.text: And the others getting drunk off their choppers in camp.

session_synopses.Goblin_02: This goblin is leading a band of looters in an abandoned house. They're too distracted by greed to fight, but if the player persists they'll attack.
session_synopses.AD_Boss: A goblin is scouting the village looking for loot, weapons, something of value
session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snarling, turning to the player

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.text: What are you doing? Get back!

session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Time to leg it out of here.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Player
Corpse_Dead.text: What brought you to the village?

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Dead Tiefling
Corpse_Dead.text: Strange warriors... gold skin... silver blades...

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Lae'zel
Corpse_Dead.text: Quick of foot, this one, to avoid githyanki hunters.

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

SlowDown.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

session_synopses.SlowDown: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely, or speed up, after the player changed the speed. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

VB_Mirror.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.

PAD_EnterSecretLab.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterSecretLab.text: A well-guarded laboratory. What were they hiding down here?

VB_Trap.speaker: Player
VB_Trap.context: NodeContext: A relieved observation. An automated booby trap that had been causing strife just ran out of fuel.

session_synopses.VB_Mirror: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player notices something odd about a mirror, but they can't quite figure out what (they're in fact detecting the energy of a magical trap that resides within the mirror).
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.PAD_EnterSecretLab: PAD when you enter the Thayan lab in the cellar (after convincing the magical mirror to open for you). It's obviously long abandoned, but full of twisted glass flasks and other old lab equipment.
session_synopses.AD_QuasitReactsToTrap: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.
session_synopses.VB_Trap: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - it just ran out of energy and they survived.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakePlans: Player reads the blueprints of an incredible weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakeJournal: The players read a journal from an apprentice smith who wrote about how he'd designed a powerful weapon.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: You're mistaken - I'm no True Soul.

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

AD_OwlbearDead.speaker: Brynna
AD_OwlbearDead.text: We did it. For Edowin. And the Absolute.
AD_OwlbearDead.context: NodeContext: Amazed and jubilant. She just witnessed her superior slay a dangerous beast.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearDead: Two cult novices express jubilation as their leader successfully kills a dangerous wild beast that killed their brother.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: And deny you the honour of my hospitality?

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

PAD_SeluniteNecklace.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluniteNecklace.context: NodeContext: Upon seeing a Selunite necklace

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteNecklace: Reflection on the Selunite necklace found in the abandoned village.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.
session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Worg laughing at the unfoiruntae gnome getting tossed around.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Never thought I'd ever walk in on a bugbear and an ogre.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Everytime I close my eyes, I can see... it.

session_synopses.PAD_AfterFight: VB that plays after killing the bugbear and the ogre when we got attacked barging in on them having sex.Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 ended up fighting them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: A drow...? Erm, I mean, glory to you, True Soul.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).
session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.text: Gonna add your ears to my collection once you're dead!

PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged.speaker: Karlach
PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged.context: NodeContext: Relieved and self-satisfied, a little tired after raging out

session_synopses.PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged: After Karlach's enrage she will feel a lot more relieved.

PAD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundKey.text: A key. Wonder what it opens?

PAD_GnollsDead.speaker: Player
PAD_GnollsDead.text: Whatever killed those gnolls might be nearby. Careful.

AD_RefugeeGreeting.speaker: Anders
AD_RefugeeGreeting.text: At ease, friend. You're welcome to rest here.
AD_RefugeeGreeting.context: NodeContext: warm greeting as players enter a building where this man's companions are resting

session_synopses.PAD_FoundKey: Lines spoken when the player spots a key in the undergrowth near a tollhouse. Different variations depending on what the player already knows about the key.
session_synopses.PAD_GnollsDead: Player comment spoken when seeing a pack of dead gnolls
session_synopses.AD_RefugeeGreeting: A warm greeting as players enter the tollhouse controlled by the faux-paladin's group

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: What? Why...? Never mind. I don't want to know.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: ... good. I've enough trouble as it is - look at that lot down there.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Those things you're masquerading as. Armed to the teeth. And they've a dragon.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I was counting on crossing that bridge and heading to Baldur's Gate. To safety.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Now I've got to find another way around. Take your chances against that lot if you like.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Don't follow me - find your own way.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Seems you have good survival instincts - maybe you should join me instead.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I go my own way. Alone.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: What easy prey you make, walking right within my blade's embrace.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?
Confrontation.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: Play along as a gith. Say you're indeed from the crèche.

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Unusual runes are etched on the slate, forming an array of arcs and circles.*
ReadingMap.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[reuse] Player produces slate from intventory

ReadingMap.speaker: Player
ReadingMap.text: Focus on the object. Perhaps you can reveal its secrets.

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Magical energy courses through the slate. You are flooded with understanding.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *A mystical map glows before you, revealing a githyanki refuge inside a temple within the mountain pass.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *The slate also reveals the githyanki's purpose: they are combing the Sword Coast in search of a polyhedric relic of great importance to their queen.*

Sign_AD.speaker: Narrator
Sign_AD.text: *Baldur's Gate: Northwest. Elturel: South. Moonrise Towers: West.*

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.text: You are outmatched. An inglorious bloodletting awaits.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.text: A dragon-rider. My kin are hunting - blood will be spilled.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.context: NodeContext: Unnerved at the sight of a dragon flying overhead

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: Get to work, Baretha! Search the dead!
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: You heard him - search every corpse!
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Directed towards the other two gith warriors who are present.

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.ConfrontationLaezel:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.Confrontation: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.ZorruFriend_Dead: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn: Small remark that the players don't stand a chance.
session_synopses.PAD_DragonShadow: A dragon flies over the party. They may or may not  recognise it. If they're a gith, they'll always recognise it and suppose that their kin must be operating nearby.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingCorpses: Kith'rak Voss, a high-ranking gith warrior, berates his underling, Sarth Baretha, and orders her and her warriors to search the corpses of some humans they'rve just killed. They are looking for 'the weapon' (in fact a strange puzzle box in the possession of our party).

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.text: An unlikely place for such a fortunate find.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow: Party with drow in it comes upon a dead drow and comments on the armour. The second speaker is always a Dr
session_synopses.DeadFF1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.
session_synopses.DeadCiv1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.
session_synopses.DeadGoblin1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the goblin raiders. He was killed chasing a child through the inn.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: By the gods, you're a sweet sight.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Are any of my crew still alive out there?

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: This whole journey's been one grim sight after another. Gnolls, goblins... drow.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: sadly, with disgust and fear on the last word

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. You're the first friendly face we've seen since Elturgard.

Agent_001.speaker: Player
Agent_001.text: Elturgard's a long way from here. Where are you heading?

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: We're bound for Baldur's Gate - got some cargo to deliver. But we've a stop to make along the way.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Waukeen's Rest. It's just up the road. I'd be enjoying a mug of ale right now if those beasts hadn't jumped us.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: Wau-KEEN's Rest is a tavern. Regretful

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Listen. You look like you know how to handle yourself.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: Pause before speaking as he looks us up and down, appraising us

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: You should meet my associates. We've got our own drinking spot by the tavern - invitation only.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: With a smile on 'invitation only'

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Tell the fellow on the door 'little serpent, long shadow'. He'll take good care of you.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: inviting us into his secret club

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: Keep steady. We're not finished yet.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: The fire's the only thing holding them back!
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: I've been in worse spots, lad. Just follow my lead.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation

Agent_002_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead.context: NodeContext: after successfully casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_001_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_001_Dead.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.Agent_001: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_FlasksLow: Trapped in a cave by monsters, Olly and Rugan are running low on fire flasks.Olly is panicking and shouting to Rugan as they attempt to hold the line; Rugan is more experienced and putting on a calmer, braver face.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Oll, a young Zhentarim agent
session_synopses.Agent_001_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Rugan.

PAD_OtherWay.speaker: Player
PAD_OtherWay.text: There's got to be another way in.
PAD_OtherWay.context: NodeContext: The burning is on fire. Said with some urgency.

session_synopses.PAD_OtherWay: Player remarks that there must be a way inside the burning building if they weren't able to bust down the front door.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Stop staring, start helping!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Less angry and more annoyed, actually.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Grand Duke Ravengard could be inside! Don't just stand there - push!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent and focused; slightly annoyed with PC.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What happened to this place?

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Goblins and drow happened.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Impatient; this is really not the time for backstory.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Now push, damn it!

PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.speaker: Player
PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.text: They do seem a bit short-handed.

session_synopses: A group of Flaming Fists are trying to force a way into the burning inn at Waukeen's Rest. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be Grand Duke Ravengard, who they had been sent to protect.
session_synopses.PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon: The player has just told a Flaming Fist guard that Zhentarim are hiding in a nearby cave. The guard brushes it off because they don't have the numbers to take on a Zhent stronghold.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

AD_InvestigationCheck.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
